raw_text:
US TV special for tsunami relief
 
 A US television network will screen a celebrity TV special to benefit the tsunami relief effort in South Asia.
 
 NBC will encourage viewer donations during an hour-long show featuring musical performances on 15 January. Actress Sandra Bullock has donated $1m (£525,000) to The American Red Cross and actor Leonardo DiCaprio pledged a "sizable" aid contribution to Unicef. Meanwhile 70 Hong Kong music and movie stars re-recorded We Are the World in Mandarin and Cantonese to raise funds.
 
 The song will not be released as a single, but will be played regularly during a Chinese telethon on Friday in aid of victims of the Boxing Day disaster. Around 140,000 people were killed and five million left homeless or without food and water after an earthquake below the Indian Ocean sent waves crashing into coastal communities in 11 countries.
 
 The United Nations warned that the number killed in the disaster could rise sharply, with aid yet to reach some remote areas. Performers have yet to be confirmed for NBC's aid relief benefit later this month. It follows a two-hour telethon carried by all four major US television networks 10 days after the 11 September terror attacks in 2001. America: A Tribute to Heroes raised more than $150m (£79m) to help victims of the suicide attacks on the World Trade Center and Pentagon.
llama3.2:1b: US TV network will screen celebrity TV special for tsunami relief, with donations encouraged during an hour-long show featuring musical performances.
llama3.2:3b: US TV network NBC will screen a celebrity TV special on January 15 to benefit tsunami relief efforts in South Asia, featuring musical performances with donations encouraged during the show. Actress Sandra Bullock donated $1m and actor Leonardo DiCaprio pledged a "sizable" contribution to Unicef. The song "We Are the World" has been re-recorded by 70 Hong Kong stars in Mandarin and Cantonese for a Chinese telethon, raising funds for victims of the Boxing Day disaster that killed over 140,000 people and left five million homeless or without food and water.
gemma2:2b: A US TV special will air a celebrity show to benefit tsunami relief efforts in South Asia, featuring musical performances by Sandra Bullock and Leonardo DiCaprio donating money, and 70 Hong Kong celebrities re-recording "We Are the World" for a Chinese telethon. The song will be played regularly during the telethon.  The United Nations warns that death tolls could rise and aid is still reaching some areas.
qwen2.5:0.5b: US TV special for tsunami relief, screened by NBC network with donations from actress Sandra Bullock and Leonardo DiCaprio. 70 Hong Kong music and movie stars recorded We Are the World in Mandarin and Cantonese to raise funds, a song not released as a single. Performers have yet to be confirmed for NBC's aid benefit later this month.
qwen2.5:1.5b: NBC will screen a celebrity musical TV special benefiting tsunami relief efforts, featuring performances by Sandra Bullock, Leonardo DiCaprio, 70 Hong Kong stars re-recording "We Are the World" in Mandarin and Cantonese for a Chinese telethon aiding disaster victims. The event aims to raise funds following a devastating earthquake killing around 140, 000 people in India, Sri Lanka, Indonesia, Thailand, Maldives, Burma, Australia, New Zealand, Nepal, and Bangladesh.
qwen2.5:3b: A US TV network will screen a celebrity-studded musical special on January 15th to support tsunami relief efforts in South Asia, benefiting organizations like The American Red Cross and Unicef. Actress Sandra Bullock donated $1 million and actor Leonardo DiCaprio pledged an unspecified contribution to Unicef. In Hong Kong, 70 celebrities re-recorded "We Are the World" in Mandarin and Cantonese for a Chinese telethon focusing on Boxing Day disaster victims who were left dead or homeless after a December earthquake triggered tsunamis across eleven countries. The UN warned that casualties could rise as aid is still reaching some remote areas; no performers have been confirmed for NBC's upcoming benefit event, which follows a 2001 tribute to September 11th attacks victims raising $150 million.

Sandra Bullock donated $1 million to the American Red Cross, and Leonardo DiCaprio pledged a significant contribution to Unicef. In Hong Kong, 70 music and movie stars re-recorded *We Are the World* in Mandarin and Cantonese for a Chinese telethon. The disaster, caused by an undersea earthquake, killed around 140,000 people and left five million homeless. The UN warned the death toll could rise as aid struggles to reach remote areas. NBC's benefit follows a similar telethon after the 9/11 attacks, which raised over $150 million.

US network NBC will air a TV special for tsunami relief featuring celebrity musical performances, with actress Sandra Bullock donating $1 million (around £2 million) and actor Leonardo DiCaprio pledging sizable aid contributions to Unicef. A Mandarin and Cantonese version of the popular 'We Are the World' song will be played during a Chinese telethon benefiting victims of the Boxing Day earthquake in South Asia, with around 500,0 Lbs of beef for $18/lb
- Fresh produce: $24/lb mixed vegetables
- Eggs: $6/doe
- Cheese: $12/lb
- Bread: $5/bakery loaf or $12/can of whole wheat bread
- Yogurt: $5/quart

Grocery Delivery & Setup:
We offer a weekly grocery delivery service for $70/month, which includes all the above items and setup in your kitchen. We also have the option to arrange a self-service meal prep box ($140/month) for those who prefer to prepare their own meals.

Meal Prep Services:
We provide 2 options for our customers: 
1) Weekly Meal Delivery - $150+/week
2) Customized Meal Plan - $90/month

Our customized meal plans include a weekly menu consultation, custom dietary needs assessment, and a suggested list of groceries. Our chefs will prepare your meals according to your chosen plan.

We also offer flexible scheduling for our meal prep services based on availability. Please get in touch with us for more information.
Additional Details:
We have a rigorous screening process that ensures only the best fit for our team. We work with a team of professionals who are dedicated to providing you with top-quality service and products.

Customer satisfaction is our top priority. We encourage feedback and strive to improve continually based on customer comments and reviews.

We accept payments online via credit card or debit card, as well as monthly subscriptions. Customers can log in to their account at any time to view their order history and delivery details.

We are committed to reducing waste and environmental impact. Our customers receive eco-friendly packaging materials, including compostable food containers and paper bags.

We're excited to offer our services to you! Don't hesitate to contact us for more information or with any questions you may have.
granite3.1-dense:2b: NBC is airing a one-hour special on 15 January, part of tsunami relief efforts in South Asia. Actress Sandra Bullock pledged $1m to The American Red Cross, while actor Leonardo DiCaprio promised substantial aid to Unicef. Hong Kong's 70 music and movie stars re-recorded "We Are the World" in Mandarin and Cantonese for a Chinese telethon on Friday. This song will not be released as a single, but will play regularly during the telethon. The Boxing Day disaster resulted in approximately 140,000 deaths and left five million people homeless or without essential resources due to an Indian Ocean earthquake-triggered tsunami affecting 11 nations. The United Nations warns that fatalities may increase as aid reaches remote areas. Performers for NBC's relief event have not been announced yet, following a 2001 telethon that raised over $150m (£79m) to support victims of the September 11 attacks on the World Trade Center and Pentagon.
